snippet: Research from the off the Malay Archipelago draws a connection between the stability of reefs and the diversity of the fish living there.
abstract: Researchers report that diversity of life off Malay Archipelago, between Southeast Asia and Australia, is due to stability of coral reefs there over past three million years.
lead_paragraph: Research from the off the Malay Archipelago draws a connection between the stability of reefs and the diversity of the fish living there.

headline.main: When Coral Reefs Thrive, So Does Variety in Fish
headline.print_headline: Marine Life: When Coral Reefs Thrive, So Does Variety in Fish
